issues.description: The `singFarmSongVerse` method in `Farm.java` in the template repository has its `Animal animal` parameter commented out. This contradicts the UML diagram (line 19) and the textual description (lines 112-137) in the problem statement, which clearly indicate that this method should accept an `Animal` object as a parameter. Students will be unable to implement the `singFarmSong()` method as intended without manually correcting this method signature.
issues.suggested_fix: In `template_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/Farm.java`, change the signature of `singFarmSongVerse` from `private void singFarmSongVerse(/*Animal animal*/) {` to `private void singFarmSongVerse(Animal animal) {`.

issues.description: The `singFarmSongVerse` method in the template repository's `Farm.java` has its `Animal animal` parameter commented out. However, the problem statement's UML diagram and the solution repository's implementation clearly define this method with an `Animal` parameter. This inconsistency can confuse students regarding the method's required signature, potentially leading them to implement it incorrectly without the necessary parameter.
issues.suggested_fix: Uncomment the `Animal animal` parameter in the `singFarmSongVerse` method signature in `template_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/Farm.java` to align with the problem statement and intended solution.

issues.description: The commented-out example code in the template repository's `Main.java` suggests that `Seal`, `Pig`, and `Goat` constructors take two parameters (e.g., `new Seal("Clarabelle", "marine")`). However, the problem statement's UML diagram and task descriptions only specify a single `name` attribute for the `Animal` class (which these classes inherit), and the solution repository's implementations of these constructors correctly take only one parameter. This discrepancy can mislead students into implementing incorrect constructor signatures and potentially adding unnecessary attributes to their animal classes.
issues.suggested_fix: Update the commented-out constructor calls in `template_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/Main.java` to match the single-parameter constructors (e.g., change `Seal seal = new Seal("Clarabelle", "marine");` to `Seal seal = new Seal("Clarabelle");`).
